intro: Kohautia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Kohautia parviflora plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
